text: Beethoven in the background Tolstoj crater (top center) and Bashō crater (lower left), with Vālmiki in the right corner. Vālmiki is a crater on Mercury. Its name was adopted by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) in 1976. It is named for the Indian poet Valmiki. Vālmiki is one of many peak- ring basins on Mercury. Vālmiki is located between the ancient, large craters Tolstoj (to the west) and Beethoven (to the east). ==References== Category:Impact craters on Mercury
title: Vālmiki (crater)
